alert.note: Alert for Fremont (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 13 at 3:31PM MDT until June 15 at 3:00PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Wyoming... Wind River near Kinnear affecting Fremont County. Wind River at Riverton affecting Fremont County. Wind River near Crowheart affecting Fremont County. .Warm temperatures will melt high mountain snowpack and increase river flows. For the Wind River Basin...including Dubois, Crowheart, Kinnear, Riverton...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Wind River at Riverton. * WHEN...Until Wednesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, Bankfull stage. Minor flooding downstream along left bank near Black Bridge begins. At 9.0 feet, Flood stage. Minor flooding along the right and left banks upstream of the Highway 789 Bridge. Agricultural flooding downstream of Riverton near the Black Bridge and Hidden Valley area intensifies. At 10.0 feet, Extensive agricultural flooding downstream of Riverton near the Black Bridge and Hidden Valley area. Water begins to encroach homes along the right bank. At 11.0 feet, Major flooding of homes along the right bank. Water begins to encroach low lying areas west of Highway 789. At 12.0 feet, Flood waters continue to invade low lying areas west of Highway 789. Highway 789 may be sand leveed by wydot on the south side of the river. Widespread and very extensive agricultural flooding downstream of Riverton near the Black Bridge and Hidden Valley area. Need to monitor closely irrigation canals upstream of Riverton for possibe overflow problems. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:00 PM MDT Monday the stage was 9.3 feet. - Forecast...The river will oscillate above flood stage with a maximum value of 10.2 feet just after midnight tonight. It will fall below flood stage late Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 9.3 feet on 06/30/2020. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. This warning will be in effect until the river falls below its flood stage. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 1200 AM MDT.
